summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 8, 2020, to an unnamed attorney. It demands the attorney's appearance before the grand jury on July 21, 2020, and the production of documents related to a real estate transaction involving Granite Realty, LLC and a property, specifically including any records referencing Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the subpoena's request for records; any documents related to or referencing her must be produced.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to an attorney, demanding testimony and document production related to a property transaction and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the attorney to appear before the federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is issued in connection with a federal grand jury investigation into suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity), and 2422(b) (coercion or enticement of a minor).

It specifically demands all non-privileged documents related to a real estate transaction involving 'Granite Realty, LLC' and a property, including any records 'related to or referencing Ghislaine Maxwell.'
The document reveals an active criminal investigation by the SDNY in July 2020, focusing on financial and property records potentially linked to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The recipient is an attorney, and the government requests confidentiality, asking them not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to preserve the investigation.
The subpoena allows for the production of records in lieu of a personal appearance if submitted by the return date with a custodian of records declaration.
